questions.questionText: Which of the following is correct about JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The standard threesome of polymorphism, encapsulation, and inheritance are the criteria for object orientation, and JavaScript fails to meet them.

questions.questionText: . Arrays in JavaScript are defined by which of the following statements?

options.text: It is an ordered list of objects
It is an ordered list of string
It is an ordered list of functions
It is an ordered list of values

questions.explanation: : An array in JavaScript is an ordered list of values, each value is referred to as an element, and it is identified by an index. An array can include values of many sorts and the length of an array dynamically sized.

questions.questionText: Why event handlers is needed in JS?

options.text: Adds innerHTML page to the code
Allows JavaScript code to alter the behaviour of windows.
Performs handling of exceptions and occurrences

questions.explanation: JS code can change the behavior of windows, documents, and the elements that make up those documents via event handlers

questions.questionText: Which of the following is the property that is triggered in response to JS errors?
questions.explanation: The Window object’s onerror property acts as an event handler, and it is triggered when JavaScript problems occur. However, because it is called with various arguments, it isn’t a genuine event handler.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is not an error in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: In JavaScript, division by zero does not result in an error; it just returns infinity or negative infinity. However, because zero divided by zero has no well-defined value, the result of this operation is the unusual not-a-number value, which is written as NaN.
